article:
{{taxobox
 | image = Anabaenaflosaquae EPA.jpg image_caption = [[Anabaena flos-aquae]]

 | name = Nostocales regnum = Bacteria subregnum = Eubacteria phylum =
 | Cyanobacteria classis = Cyanophyceae ordo = 'Nostocales' ordo_authority =
 | T.Cavalier-Smith
}}

The 'Nostocales' is an order of cyanobacteria containing most of its species. It
includes filamentous forms, both simple or branched, and both those occurring as
single strands or multiple strands within a sheath. Some but not all members
show a decrease in width from the base. Again, some but not all have
heterocysts.

The families included
are [http://www.bacterio.cict.fr/p/pseudonocardiaceae.html Nostocales on
www.bacterio.cict.fr] :
* Microchaetaceae
* Nostocaceae
* Rivulariaceae
* Scytonemataceae
